website_summaries.verdict: A 5-piece set that includes expertly crafted hand files in a variety of shapes.
pros: Ergonomic handles provide a comfortable grip at all times
American pattern teeth make it simple to remove non-precision materials
Includes a vinyl pouch so you can store all of your files in one place
cons: Handles may become loose and fall off due to extended use

customer_reviews.title: Quality is suspect... Sloppy packaging, labeling, etc.
customer_reviews.text: OK I suppose. Only time will tell. There are tell-tale signs that brings quality into question. .The Amazon listing Is FALSE ADVERTISING ... zooming in on the graphics says “made in USA” - NOT TRUE! my set I just got has 1 file made in Brazil, the rest in Mexico (poorly stamped near handle). Also, the plastic soft case they came in lists/shows one of the two 8” files as double cut - that is also NOT TRUE. pretty sloppy I think and brings into question the care and quality of products sold by Nicholson. Maybe time to stop assuming that Nicholson makes a good product.
customer_reviews.author: All Is Well in Hillsborough NJ

customer_reviews.title: 5 in 1 , 1 in 5 no one here gets out alive
customer_reviews.text: Jim Morrison. I know, I am odd. Anyway, I have lots of files from my days of being a machinist but they’re all little ones. Wanted some larger sizes for sharpening the tractor blades, axes, shovels and mostly that type of stuff. Nice set. Made in Mexico 🇲🇽. For some reason, leather and files are two of the things that it seems like the best come out of Mexico. Excellent workmanship. As nice if not nicer than anything I’ve seen. Laser straight, great edges and very comfortable handles. Good steel that seems to be properly heat treated. Came in a fairly decent pouch. I’m very impressed. Highly recommend. Thanks for reading
customer_reviews.author: MooseTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving Photo - Not Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: The item photo clearly shows files stamped "Made in USA", but files received are made in Mexico. So much for trying to support the American worker.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy and worked great
customer_reviews.text: I’m not the handiest person, but since purchasing our house, I’m learning a lot. Our loppers were heavily used, heavily pitted, and had some serious dings that were making it hard to close. I watched a YouTube video to learn how to sharpen my tools, bought these, and they worked a treat. I can close my loppers again, they’re working great, and hopefully they’ll prevent spreading any diseases amongst my plants. I also sharpened my shovel and a few other blades for my garden, and look forward to many years of use from these files.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: I expect to just get another file but these are really  great
customer_reviews.text: my oh my I am impressed these are great and really eat that metal , these tools are better than any other files I have had in my hands in at least the last 50 years ok maybe the last 40 years to be honest and the handles feel great too.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought these years ago. That vulgar name means they're coase cut - in case you wondered. I had a negative experience with those "other guys" and good old Amazon came through with quick delivery and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Good quality files
customer_reviews.text: Nicholson has been making quality files for many years and these are too. A cheap file is the most aggrivating tool in your shop, but these won't let you down.

customer_reviews.title: Other companies sell files?
customer_reviews.text: Nicholson is the standard in most any construction/manufacturing industry. Make sure to get yourself one of the big (11"?) half round bastard files too but you might be surprised how often this set of smaller files comes in handy. The package/ kit holder came totally wrecked (DISTROID) but it didn't make any difference to me.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of files.

customer_reviews.title: Great set of files!
customer_reviews.text: I am in charge of buying tools for my job. We had not bought a set of files for decades. Needless to say, we were in need. We typically do not use files everyday, but it is a couple times a week on average. This set has held up well so far, and is as sharp as the day we bought them. The ergonomic handles also make them extremely comfortable to use. I have no regrets about this item.

customer_reviews.title: For the price point these are good.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional nor a machinist or tool-maker. For the every day person or general mechanic these files are of reasonable quality and utility. For the price point these are good.

customer_reviews.title: Ok price but disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased Nicholson files as they historically were well made and made in the USA. Sadly, as is the broader trend, these particular files are made in Brazil and Mexico, with the finish of the Brazilian made files in this set being noticeably worse than the Mexico ones. So far they remove metal fine but I wouldn't buy again after seeing the Brazilian versions.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product

customer_reviews.text: Works great. Have only used the rat tail and the smaller flat bastard but both felt great in the hands and took the material off with ease.

customer_reviews.text: Good looking set of basic files. Don't forget to order a file card to keep them clean and cutting freely.

customer_reviews.title: Love the handles.  Good files.
customer_reviews.text: I have given all five files a workout in the last month. They cut well. The handles are VERY comfortable. It's not really safe to use a file without a handle, even though everyone does it. Do yourself a favor--buy these files with handles so you don't have to worry about puncture wounds when a tool slips.

customer_reviews.text: If you have a worn out set of files, get these. I am glad I did.

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Set of Files
customer_reviews.text: This is a good basic set of files. Worth a few extra dollars. My first use was shaping some Trex for a special project and the larger file was just right for the job. I would prefer a slightly longer handle, but this one if fine. My task would have been easier if the set had a rasp for rough shaping.

customer_reviews.title: Great Files!
customer_reviews.text: These are great files! Especially for the price... I have an old ax that was duller than a butter knife... Now it is as sharp as a razor... Very sturdy and well made.. I would highly recommend these files to anyone...

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy

customer_reviews.text: These supposedly are as good as the Made in USA files of years gone by. But I've found them to be pretty effective for filing axes, knives, lawnmower blades, shovels... haven't used the little ones too much yet. It's a very handsome set. Handles very comfortable. Keep them clean with a File Card brush... just like Wranglerstar.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic

product_meta.title: Nicholson 22040HNN 5 Piece Hand File Set with Ergonomic Handles, American Pattern, 6" Length, (2)-8" length, (2)-10" length
product_meta.description:
The Nicholson file set is an assortment of 5 files in a variety of shapes that have ergonomic handles and American pattern teeth for non-precision material removal in a range of home or shop uses. Attached rubber-coated handles provide an ergonomic grip. The set comes in a vinyl pouch for storage.

Hand files are used to remove material and smooth and shape workpieces. They have forward-facing cutting teeth and cut when pushed over either a stationary or rotating workpiece. Single-cut teeth are single rows cut diagonally across the width of the file. Double-cut teeth have two sets of rows cut in opposite directions. American pattern files have three coarseness grades. Coarse, also known as bastard cut, is suitable for efficient, heavy material removal where finish is not a concern. Medium, also known as second cut, offers average material removal and finish quality. Fine, also known as smooth cut, provides the smoothest finish. Swiss pattern files have eight coarseness grades, from 00 (coarse), 0 (medium), and 1 to 6 (fine to finest), offering a smoother finish than equivalent American pattern files. For Swiss pattern files the length of the tool is the length of the blade, not counting the tang, which is the pointed end fitted for a handle; for American pattern files the length of the tool is its entire length, including the tang.

Nicholson manufactures hand tools and power tool accessories. The company is headquartered in Sparks, MD.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 * Rectangular (mill) file, 10"/250 mm, coarse (bastard) grade
 * Half-round file, 10"/250 mm, coarse (bastard) grade
 * Rectangular (mill) file, 8"/200 mm, coarse (bastard) grade
 * Rectangular (flat) file, 8"/200 mm, coarse (bastard) grade
 * Slim taper file, 6"/150 mm, coarse (bastard) grade 
 * Vinyl storage pouch



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Set of 5 files fit easily and securely into rugged, compact pouch Set Includes: 10-Inch /250mm half-round bastard file 10-Inch /250mm mill bastard file 8-Inch /200mm mill bastard file 8-Inch /200mm mill smooth file 6-Inch /150mm slim taper file.
feature_bullets: Set of 5 files in a variety of shapes for a range of home or shop uses
American pattern files for non-precision material removal
Attached rubber-coated ergonomic handles for grip
Comes in a plastic pouch for storage
Set of 5 files fit easily and securely into rugged, compact pouch
8-Inch /200mm mill smooth file 6-Inch /150mm slim taper file
